wiki.summary: "I Love You So" is a song by American indie-pop band the Walters. It was released on November 28, 2014 from band's first EP "Songs for Dads". In 2021, it went viral on video sharing app TikTok, where it has over half a million views, and gained over 350 million streams on Spotify. This song describes a man’s internal struggle regarding a relationship with a lover. He describes this struggle with his significant other through the song and eventually finds himself wanting to be without her despite his strong love for her. Read more on Last.fm.
wiki.content: "I Love You So" is a song by American indie-pop band the Walters. It was released on November 28, 2014 from band's first EP "Songs for Dads". In 2021, it went viral on video sharing app TikTok, where it has over half a million views, and gained over 350 million streams on Spotify. This song describes a man’s internal struggle regarding a relationship with a lover. He describes this struggle with his significant other through the song and eventually finds himself wanting to be without her despite his strong love for her. In 2017, the band performed in Lollapalooza, hereafter they announced the band temporarily disbanded. Until mid-2021, the song started to become popular on TikTok, at this time the band's members reconnected together, and signed with Warner Records. In a press release, the band said: "'I Love You So'. This song kicked off our career and now it's the song that got the band back together". About the internet meme on TikTok, the band told magazine Variety: "It was a sign from the universe, There's a reason why this song keeps coming back into our lives, and the TikTok virality was definitely the extra kick we needed to be like, 'Okay, let's give this another shot and let's try to make the most of it.'". Read more on Last.fm. User-contributed text is available under the Creative Commons By-SA License; additional terms may apply.
